intro: Lipara nigra, commonly known as the black lipara, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers, which are typically tubular in shape and attract various pollinators. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem, and it often grows in moist, shaded environments. It is native to parts of tropical Africa and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is relatively rare and requires careful cultivation.
